page.title: 02HISTORY OF LETHAM
page.content: Letham has a short history being planned in 1788 by George Dempster and built on his estate of Dunnichen as part of a programme of Agricultural Reform which aimed to improve his estate and the lot of his tenant farmers and workers. It was to be a source of labour for the estate and healthy young men to "recruit for the army and navy".Each feu was very cheap at Â£2 per acre. It was also to be a centre for a cottage linen weaving industry.The original houses have a little window in the gable to light the end of the loom.On the Vinney (stream) two plash mills prepared and spun yarn to supply these looms.The cottage industry failed because of the Industrial Revolution and the income of the villagers was much reduced.In 1811 the population was 350.
